segment.target: Configure settings by using Intune

segment.source: Now, you’re ready to configure settings by using Intune.
segment.target: Now, you’re ready to configure settings by using Intune.

segment.source: The steps in this section assume that you have an Office 365 subscription.
segment.target: The steps in this section assume that you have an Office 365 subscription.

segment.source: You will configure the Intune settings that you selected in the Select Microsoft-recommended settings section.
segment.target: You will configure the Intune settings that you selected in the Select Microsoft-recommended settings section.

segment.source: For more information about Intune, see Documentation for Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about Intune, see Documentation for Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: To configure Intune settings
segment.target: To configure Intune settings

segment.source: Add Intune to your Office 365 subscription by completing the steps in Get started with a paid subscription to Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Add Intune to your Office 365 subscription by completing the steps in Get started with a paid subscription to Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Enroll devices with Intune by completing the steps in Get ready to enroll devices in Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Enroll devices with Intune by completing the steps in Get ready to enroll devices in Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Configure the settings in Intune Windows 10 policies by completing the steps in Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies.
segment.target: Configure the settings in Intune Windows 10 policies by completing the steps in Manage settings and features on your devices with Microsoft Intune policies.

segment.source: Manage Windows 10 devices by completing the steps in Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: Manage Windows 10 devices by completing the steps in Manage Windows PCs with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Deploy apps by using Intune
segment.target: Deploy apps by using Intune

segment.source: You can use Intune to deploy Windows Store and Windows desktop apps.
segment.target: You can use Intune to deploy Windows Store and Windows desktop apps.

segment.source: Intune provides improved control over which users receive specific apps.
segment.target: Intune provides improved control over which users receive specific apps.

segment.source: In addition, Intune allows you deploy apps to companion devices (such as Windows 10 Mobile, iOS, or Android devices) Finally, Intune helps you manage app security and features, such as mobile application management policies that let you manage apps on devices that are not enrolled in Intune or are managed by another solution.
segment.target: In addition, Intune allows you deploy apps to companion devices (such as Windows 10 Mobile, iOS, or Android devices) Finally, Intune helps you manage app security and features, such as mobile application management policies that let you manage apps on devices that are not enrolled in Intune or are managed by another solution.

segment.source: For more information about how to configure Intune to manage your apps, see Deploy and configure apps with Microsoft Intune.
segment.target: For more information about how to configure Intune to manage your apps, see Deploy and configure apps with Microsoft Intune.

segment.source: Summary
segment.target: Summary

segment.source: In this section, you prepared your institution for device management.
segment.target: In this section, you prepared your institution for device management.

segment.source: You determined whether you want to use Group Policy or Intune to manage your devices.
segment.target: You determined whether you want to use Group Policy or Intune to manage your devices.

segment.source: You identified the configuration settings that you want to use to manage your users and devices.
segment.target: You identified the configuration settings that you want to use to manage your users and devices.

segment.source: Finally, you configured the Group Policy and Intune settings in Group Policy and Intune, respectively.
segment.target: Finally, you configured the Group Policy and Intune settings in Group Policy and Intune, respectively.

segment.source: Deploy Windows 10 to devices
segment.target: Deploy Windows 10 to devices

segment.source: You’re ready to deploy Windows 10 to faculty and student devices.
segment.target: You’re ready to deploy Windows 10 to faculty and student devices.

segment.source: You must complete the steps in this section for each student device in the classrooms as well as for any new student devices you add in the future.
segment.target: You must complete the steps in this section for each student device in the classrooms as well as for any new student devices you add in the future.

segment.source: You can also perform these actions for any device that’s eligible for a Windows 10 upgrade.
segment.target: You can also perform these actions for any device that’s eligible for a Windows 10 upgrade.

segment.source: This section discusses deploying Windows 10 to new devices, refreshing Windows 10 on existing devices, and upgrading existing devices that are running eligible versions of Windows 8.1 or Windows to Windows 10.
segment.target: This section discusses deploying Windows 10 to new devices, refreshing Windows 10 on existing devices, and upgrading existing devices that are running eligible versions of Windows 8.1 or Windows to Windows 10.

segment.source: Prepare for deployment
segment.target: Prepare for deployment

segment.source: Prior to deployment of Windows 10, ensure that you complete the tasks listed in Table 12.
segment.target: Prior to deployment of Windows 10, ensure that you complete the tasks listed in Table 12.

segment.source: Most of these tasks are already complete, but use this step to make sure.
segment.target: Most of these tasks are already complete, but use this step to make sure.

segment.source: Table 12.
segment.target: Table 12.

segment.source: Deployment preparation checklist
segment.target: Deployment preparation checklist

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: The target devices have sufficient system resources to run Windows 10.
segment.target: The target devices have sufficient system resources to run Windows 10.

segment.source: Identify the necessary devices drivers, and import them to the MDT deployment share.
segment.target: Identify the necessary devices drivers, and import them to the MDT deployment share.

segment.source: Create an MDT application for each Windows Store and Windows desktop app.
segment.target: Create an MDT application for each Windows Store and Windows desktop app.

segment.source: Notify the students and faculty about the deployment.
segment.target: Notify the students and faculty about the deployment.

segment.source: Perform the deployment
segment.target: Perform the deployment

segment.source: Use the Deployment Wizard to deploy Windows 10.
segment.target: Use the Deployment Wizard to deploy Windows 10.

segment.source: The LTI deployment process is almost fully automated: You provide only minimal information to the Deployment Wizard at the beginning of the process.
segment.target: The LTI deployment process is almost fully automated: You provide only minimal information to the Deployment Wizard at the beginning of the process.

segment.source: After the wizard collects the necessary information, the remainder of the process is fully automated.
segment.target: After the wizard collects the necessary information, the remainder of the process is fully automated.

segment.source: Note: To fully automate the LTI deployment process, complete the steps in the “Fully Automated LTI Deployment Scenario” section in the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit Samples Guide.
segment.target: Note: To fully automate the LTI deployment process, complete the steps in the “Fully Automated LTI Deployment Scenario” section in the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit Samples Guide.

segment.source: In most instances, deployments occur without incident.
segment.target: In most instances, deployments occur without incident.

segment.source: Only in rare occasions do deployments experience problems.
segment.target: Only in rare occasions do deployments experience problems.

segment.source: To deploy Windows 10
segment.target: To deploy Windows 10

segment.source: Initiate the LTI deployment process.
segment.target: Initiate the LTI deployment process.

segment.source: Initiate the LTI deployment process booting over the network (PXE boot) or from local media.
segment.target: Initiate the LTI deployment process booting over the network (PXE boot) or from local media.

segment.source: You selected the method for initiating the LTI deployment process in the Select a method to initiate deployment section earlier in this guide.
segment.target: You selected the method for initiating the LTI deployment process in the Select a method to initiate deployment section earlier in this guide.

segment.source: Complete the Deployment Wizard.
segment.target: Complete the Deployment Wizard.

segment.source: For more information about how to complete the Deployment Wizard, see the “Running the Deployment Wizard” topic in Using the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.
segment.target: For more information about how to complete the Deployment Wizard, see the “Running the Deployment Wizard” topic in Using the Microsoft Deployment Toolkit.

segment.source: Set up printers
segment.target: Set up printers

segment.source: After you have deployed Windows 10, the devices are almost ready for use.
segment.target: After you have deployed Windows 10, the devices are almost ready for use.

segment.source: First, you must set up the printers that each classroom will use.
segment.target: First, you must set up the printers that each classroom will use.

segment.source: Typically, you connect the printers to the same network as the devices in the same classroom.
segment.target: Typically, you connect the printers to the same network as the devices in the same classroom.

segment.source: If you don’t have printers in your classrooms, skip this section and proceed to the Verify deployment section.
segment.target: If you don’t have printers in your classrooms, skip this section and proceed to the Verify deployment section.

segment.source: Note: If you’re performing an upgrade instead of a new deployment, the printers remain configured as they were in the previous version of Windows.
segment.target: Note: If you’re performing an upgrade instead of a new deployment, the printers remain configured as they were in the previous version of Windows.

segment.source: As a result, you can skip this section and proceed to the Verify deployment section.
segment.target: As a result, you can skip this section and proceed to the Verify deployment section.

segment.source: To set up printers
segment.target: To set up printers

segment.source: Review the printer manufacturer’s instructions for installing the printer drivers.
segment.target: Review the printer manufacturer’s instructions for installing the printer drivers.

segment.source: On the admin device, download the printer drivers.
segment.target: On the admin device, download the printer drivers.

segment.source: Copy the printer drivers to a USB drive.
segment.target: Copy the printer drivers to a USB drive.

segment.source: On a device, use the same account you used to set up Windows 10 in the Perform the deployment section to sign in to the device.
segment.target: On a device, use the same account you used to set up Windows 10 in the Perform the deployment section to sign in to the device.

segment.source: Insert the USB drive in the device.
segment.target: Insert the USB drive in the device.

segment.source: Follow the printer manufacturer’s instructions to install the printer drivers from the USB drive.
segment.target: Follow the printer manufacturer’s instructions to install the printer drivers from the USB drive.

segment.source: Verify that the printer drivers were installed correctly by printing a test page.
segment.target: Verify that the printer drivers were installed correctly by printing a test page.

segment.source: Complete steps 1–8 for each printer.
segment.target: Complete steps 1–8 for each printer.

segment.source: Verify deployment
segment.target: Verify deployment

segment.source: As a final quality control step, verify the device configuration to ensure that all apps run.
segment.target: As a final quality control step, verify the device configuration to ensure that all apps run.

segment.source: Microsoft recommends that you perform all the tasks that the user would perform.
segment.target: Microsoft recommends that you perform all the tasks that the user would perform.

segment.source: Specifically, verify the following:
segment.target: Specifically, verify the following:

segment.source: The device can connect to the Internet and view the appropriate web content in Microsoft Edge.
segment.target: The device can connect to the Internet and view the appropriate web content in Microsoft Edge.

segment.source: Windows Update is active and current with software updates.
segment.target: Windows Update is active and current with software updates.

segment.source: Windows Defender is active and current with malware signatures.
segment.target: Windows Defender is active and current with malware signatures.

segment.source: The SmartScreen Filter is active.
segment.target: The SmartScreen Filter is active.

segment.source: All Windows Store apps are properly installed and updated.
segment.target: All Windows Store apps are properly installed and updated.

segment.source: All Windows desktop apps are properly installed and updated.
segment.target: All Windows desktop apps are properly installed and updated.

segment.source: Printers are properly configured.
segment.target: Printers are properly configured.

segment.source: When you have verified that the first device is properly configured, you can move to the next device and perform the same steps.
segment.target: When you have verified that the first device is properly configured, you can move to the next device and perform the same steps.

segment.source: Summary
segment.target: Summary

segment.source: You prepared the devices for deployment by verifying that they have adequate system resources and that the resources in the devices have corresponding Windows 10 device drivers.
segment.target: You prepared the devices for deployment by verifying that they have adequate system resources and that the resources in the devices have corresponding Windows 10 device drivers.

segment.source: You performed device deployment over the network or by using local MDT media.
segment.target: You performed device deployment over the network or by using local MDT media.

segment.source: Next, you configured the appropriate printers on the devices.
segment.target: Next, you configured the appropriate printers on the devices.

segment.source: Finally, you verified that the devices are properly configured and ready for use.
segment.target: Finally, you verified that the devices are properly configured and ready for use.

segment.source: Maintain Windows devices and Office 365
segment.target: Maintain Windows devices and Office 365

segment.source: After the initial deployment, you will need to perform certain tasks to maintain the Windows 10 devices and your Office 365 Education subscription.
segment.target: After the initial deployment, you will need to perform certain tasks to maintain the Windows 10 devices and your Office 365 Education subscription.

segment.source: You should perform these tasks on the following schedule:
segment.target: You should perform these tasks on the following schedule:

segment.source: Monthly.
segment.target: Monthly.

segment.source: These tasks help ensure that the devices are current with software updates and properly protected against viruses and malware.
segment.target: These tasks help ensure that the devices are current with software updates and properly protected against viruses and malware.

segment.source: New semester or academic year.
segment.target: New semester or academic year.

segment.source: Perform these tasks prior to the start of a new curriculum—for example, at the start of a new academic year or semester.
segment.target: Perform these tasks prior to the start of a new curriculum—for example, at the start of a new academic year or semester.

segment.source: These tasks help ensure that the classroom environments are ready for the next group of students.
segment.target: These tasks help ensure that the classroom environments are ready for the next group of students.

segment.source: As required (ad hoc).
segment.target: As required (ad hoc).

segment.source: Perform these tasks as necessary in a classroom.
segment.target: Perform these tasks as necessary in a classroom.

segment.source: For example, a new version of an app may be available, or a student may inadvertently corrupt a device so that you must restore it to the default configuration.
segment.target: For example, a new version of an app may be available, or a student may inadvertently corrupt a device so that you must restore it to the default configuration.
